# Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge

We as members, contributors, and leaders pledge to make participation in our
community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body
size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender
identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status,
nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, or sexual
identity and orientation.

We pledge to act and interact in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming,
diverse, inclusive, and healthy community.

## Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment for our
community include:

- Demonstrating empathy and kindness toward other people
- Being respectful of differing opinions, viewpoints, and experiences
- Giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback
- Accepting responsibility and apologizing to those affected by our mistakes,
  and learning from the experience
- Focusing on what is best not just for us as individuals, but for the overall
  community

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

- The use of sexualized language or imagery, and sexual attention or advances of
  any kind
- Trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
- Public or private harassment
- Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or email address,
  without their explicit permission
- Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a
  professional setting

## Enforcement Responsibilities

Community leaders are responsible for clarifying and enforcing our standards of
acceptable behavior and will take appropriate and fair corrective action in
response to any behavior that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive,
or harmful.

Community leaders have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject
comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions that are
not aligned to this Code of Conduct, and will communicate reasons for moderation
decisions when appropriate.

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies within all community spaces, and also applies when
an individual is officially representing the community in public spaces.
Examples of representing our community include using an official e-mail address,
posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed
representative at an online or offline event.

## Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be
reported to the community leaders responsible for enforcement at
info@lxcat.net.
All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.

All community leaders are obligated to respect the privacy and security of the
reporter of any incident.

## Enforcement Guidelines

Community leaders will follow these Community Impact Guidelines in determining
the consequences for any action they deem in violation of this Code of Conduct:

### 1. Correction

**Community Impact**: Use of inappropriate language or other behavior deemed
unprofessional or unwelcome in the community.

**Consequence**: A private, written warning from community leaders, providing
clarity around the nature of the violation and an explanation of why the
behavior was inappropriate. A public apology may be requested.

### 2. Warning

**Community Impact**: A violation through a single incident or series of
actions.

**Consequence**: A warning with consequences for continued behavior. No
interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with
those enforcing the Code of Conduct, for a specified period of time. This
includes avoiding interactions in community spaces as well as external channels
like social media. Violating these terms may lead to a temporary or permanent
ban.

### 3. Temporary Ban

**Community Impact**: A serious violation of community standards, including
sustained inappropriate behavior.

**Consequence**: A temporary ban from any sort of interaction or public
communication with the community for a specified period of time. No public or
private interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction
with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, is allowed during this period.
Violating these terms may lead to a permanent ban.

### 4. Permanent Ban

**Community Impact**: Demonstrating a pattern of violation of community
standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment of an
individual, or aggression toward or disparagement of classes of individuals.

**Consequence**: A permanent ban from any sort of public interaction within the
community.

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the [Contributor Covenant][homepage],
version 2.1, available at
[https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html][v2.1].

Community Impact Guidelines were inspired by
[Mozilla's code of conduct enforcement ladder][Mozilla CoC].

For answers to common questions about this code of conduct, see the FAQ at
[https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq][FAQ]. Translations are available at
[https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations][translations].

[homepage]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org
[v2.1]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html
[Mozilla CoC]: https://github.com/mozilla/diversity
[FAQ]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq
[translations]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations
An open-access website for collecting, displaying, and downloading electron and ion scattering data for modeling low temperature plasmas.

LXCat is an open-access website for collecting, displaying, and downloading
electron and ion scattering cross sections, swarm parameters, reaction rates,
energy distribution functions, and other data required for modeling low
temperature plasmas.

The production containers can be built and started by running
```shell
docker-compose up --build
```
Subsequently, the following commands can be used to setup and fill the database.
```shell
docker compose run setup setup
# To seed the db with test data set use:
docker compose run setup seed seeds/test
# To seed the db with production data, temporarily supply the source path as a read-only volume bound to `/data`:
docker compose -v <production data path>:/data:ro setup load-css /data
# To give an already logged in user admin rights:
docker-compose run setup make-admin <email of user>
```

Members of the LXCat team wrote the LXCat code. The authors are listed in
[CITATION.cff](CITATION.cff).
Documentation for different users can be found at [docs/](docs/).

To get familiar with the code read the following documentation:

- [docs/code-contributor.md](docs/code-contributor.md) for technology choices.
- [app/README.md](app/README.md) for web application and web service.
- [packages/database/README.md](packages/database/README.md) for spinning up the
  database and filling it.
- [packages/schema/README.md](packages/schema/README.md) for JSON schemas,
  validators and Typescript types of LXCat documents.
- [packages/converter/README.md](packages/converter/README.md) for conversion to
  the legacy LXCat format.

The production containers can be built and started by running
```shell
docker-compose up --build
```
Subsequently, the following commands can be used to setup and fill the database.
```shell
docker compose run setup setup
# To seed the db with test data set use:
docker compose run setup seed seeds/test
# To seed the db with production data, temporarily supply the source path as a read-only volume bound to `/data`:
docker compose -v <production data path>:/data:ro setup load-css /data
# To give an already logged in user admin rights:
docker-compose run setup make-admin <email of user>
```
 
The web application will run at `http://localhost:3000`. The app should be
reversed proxied by a web server to provide https.

<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at main -->

## What's Changed
### Enhancements and new features
* Annotate separate components of the cross section selection interface by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1351
* Add the cross section threshold to the process table on the selection page by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1352
* Improve missing state/reference key errors in document types by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1363
* Add list of contributors to homepage by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1365
* Display selected dataset information on the inspect page  by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1367
* Add a demo alert box to the top of every page by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1370
* Add LXCat icon as favicon by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1371
### Bug fixes
* Avoid calling protected endpoints on the inspect page when downloading data by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1366
### Dependency updates
* Build(deps-dev): Bump postcss-preset-env from 10.0.3 to 10.0.4 by @dependabot in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1355
* Build(deps): Bump mermaid from 11.2.0 to 11.2.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1357
* Build(deps-dev): Bump eslint-config-next from 14.2.11 to 14.2.13 by @dependabot in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1359
* Build(deps): Bump next from 14.2.11 to 14.2.13 by @dependabot in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1360
* Build(deps-dev): Bump nyc from 17.0.0 to 17.1.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1354
* Build(deps-dev): Bump @types/react from 18.3.5 to 18.3.8 by @dependabot in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1356
* Build(deps): Bump @next/bundle-analyzer from 14.2.11 to 14.2.13 by @dependabot in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1353
* Build(deps): Bump napi from 2.16.10 to 2.16.11 in /packages/converter by @dependabot in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1362


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/compare/v3.0.0.beta.4...v3.0.0.beta.5

### Enhancements and new features

## What's Changed
### Enhancements and new features
* Add `convert` command for `@lxcat/converter` package by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1105
* Treat species chemical composition more accurately by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1104
* Minor `@lxcat/schema` cleanups by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1213
* Add a set selection interface based on the periodic table by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1237
### Other changes
* Incorporate rust files when generating cache keys by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1103
* Update `node` to `v22` by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1221
* Update csl schema to be in line with the crossref api by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1222

result.description:
<!-- Release notes generated using configuration in .github/release.yml at main -->

## What's Changed
### Enhancements and new features
* Do not run CI workflows on draft pull requests by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/129
* Dependabot integration by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/131
* Auto-merge dependabot pull requests by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/142
* Enable hover on highlight in nested Mantine `DataTable` by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/179
* Update `LatexSelect` component by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/180
* Make data select component more robust to container resizes by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/181
* Increase number of simultaneous PRs for npm packages by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/198
* Cleanup plot pages by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/231
* Increase maximum number of  open dependabot pull requests by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/426
* Generalize schemas by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/547
* Update `@mantine/core` and  `mantine-datatable` to `v7.x` by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/569
* Use Codecov for coverage tracking by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/570
* Harden database connection by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/585
* Reduce the number of required `.env*` files by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/586
* Collect coverage in end-to-end tests by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/642
* Cleanup codebase by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/644
* Add a `json:doc` script to generate the `LTPDocument` schema by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/686
* Port API to app router and add generated OpenAPI specification by @svgils in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/645
* Allow comments attached to references and processes by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/748
* Converter coverage by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/747
* Handle reference comments by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/766
* Add turbo `clean` command and cleanup `turbo.json` by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/767
* Update schema to include missing metadata by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/872
* Add command to separately load organizations by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/890
* Add support for triatomic molecules with the `C2v` symmetry by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/946
* Correctly set the `Access-Control-Allow-Origin` CORS header by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1021
* Overhaul of the cross section set edit form by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/996
* Add configuration for automatically generating release notes by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1085
### Documentation updates
* Update metadata by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/130
* Update root readme by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/588
* Fix API documentation by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/783
* Fix `/api-doc` page in production by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/994
* Fix description of the `/species` endpoint by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1018
### Bug fixes
* Fix dependabot workflows by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/143
* Fix auto merge workflow for dependabot PRs by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/144
* Fix `@lxcat/app` compilation by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/548
* Fix `PartakingStateSelection` query for rotational options by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/624
* Fix height disparity in `StateSelect` dropdowns by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/625
* Fix `@lxcat/database` coverage exclude paths by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/643
* Fix `drop-non-user` script in `@lxcat/database` by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/891
* Fix serialization of vibrational quanta in linear triatoms by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/947
* Use `root` account to drop collections in `drop-non-user` script by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/995
* Fix `concat` call on preflight headers by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1017
* Make the `setup` command compatible with `drop-non-user` by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/997
### Other changes
* Make process selection endpoints publicly available by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/549
* Correct copyright statement in the README by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/835
* Update `mdx` related dependencies by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/857
* Use `node:20` + `corepack` in docker containers by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/966
* Update `mantine` related dependencies by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/993
* Rename the `create` member of `LXCatDatabase` to `setup` by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/1019

result.name: v3.0.0.beta.1

result.description:
The initial LXCat v3 beta release. Most of the required functionality is implemented. This includes data selection and inspection for users, and data uploading and management for contributors. Currently only cross section data is supported. Other data types such as potentials and swarm parameters will be implemented in a succeeding version. The changelog only includes changes that were made after moving to GitHub. The subsequent changelogs will be more descriptive.

## What's Changed
* Migrate from GitLab CI to GitHub actions by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/127
* Update docs by @daanboer in https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/pull/128

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/LXCat-project/LXCat/commits/v3.0.0.beta.0
result.name: v3.0.0.beta.0
